content: Dec 7 Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd (CP Rail) is expected to revise deal terms for its acquisition of Norfolk Southern  to allay fears of a prolonged regulatory review and put cash earlier in shareholders' hands  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Canadian Pacific to revise terms of bid for Norfolk Southern -WSJ

content: U.S. railroad operator Norfolk Southern Corp  all but rejected a $28.4 billion acquisition offer by Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd  on Tuesday  calling it "low-premium" and warning it would face significant regulatory hurdles. | Video

title: Norfolk Southern hostile to Canadian Pacific's $28.4 billion bid

content: * Canadian dollar at C$1.3286 or 75.27 U.S. cents     * Bond prices higher across the maturity curve      By Fergal Smith     TORONTO  Nov 10 The Canadian dollar was slightly weaker against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday  as crude oil prices slipped and weak Chinese inflation data fed concern about the global growth outlook.
